definition: Cowherd and Weaving maid (characters in folk story)/separated lovers/Altair and Vega (stars)
surname Niu
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
surname Lang
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
to weave/to knit
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter

sentences.english: Very imaginative and interesting. Its theme is similar to the Chinese folk story.
sentences.chinese: 富有想象力，主题与中国的牛郎织女相似，很有意趣。

sentences.english: We couples who have been separated hate the ruthless "The Milky Way".
sentences.chinese: 我们这些牛郎织女都恨透了那条无情的“天河”。

sentences.english: However, it is still a day to celebrate the annual meeting of the loving couple, the Cowherd and the Girl Weaver.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它仍是牛郎织女一年一度的鹊桥相会日。

sentences.english: Niu Lang and Zhi Nu would walk towards each other on the magpies' heads to meet.
sentences.chinese: 牛郎织女踩在一只只喜鹊的头上走过去聚会。

sentences.english: Weaving maid and Cowboy got married and led a happy life, one farming, the other weaving.
sentences.chinese: 牛郎织女结婚了，一耕一织，生活很幸福。

sentences.english: Using the boundless star light as the leader, cowherd boy and vega are besides of you?
sentences.chinese: 以无边的星光作你的前导呵，牛郎织女星在你的身旁？

definition: Vega (star)/Weaving girl of folk tales
magpie bridge across the Milky Way between Altair and Vega where Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女 are allowed an annual meeting
The Butterfly Lovers, Chinese folktale of the tragic love between Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai
pinyin: Liang2 Shan1 bo2 yu3 Zhu4 Ying1 tai2

definition: Cowherd of the folk tale Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女/Altair (star)
cowherd boy/(slang) male prostitute
heroine of Qin dynasty 秦朝 folk tale, who searched for her husband, and whose tears broke down a stretch of the Great Wall to reveal his body
Vega, brightest star in constellation Lyra 天琴星座
mythological story/myth
another name for Xi Wangmu 西王母, Queen Mother of the West

Qixi Festival or Double Seven Festival on the 7th day of the 7th lunar month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女[niu2 lang3 zhi1 nu:3] are allowed their annual meeting
The Butterfly Lovers, Chinese folktale/abbr. for 梁山伯與祝英台|梁山伯与祝英台[Liang2 Shan1 bo2 yu3 Zhu4 Ying1 tai2]
minor divinity concerned with marriage/matchmaker/go-between
to fly to the moon
Chang'e, the lady in the moon (Chinese mythology)/one of the Chang'e series of PRC lunar spacecraft
lovers
lit. lovely flowers, round moon (idiom); fig. everything is wonderful/perfect happiness/conjugal bliss
Amah Rock in Sha Tin 沙田[Sha1 tian2], Hong Kong
